This property verifies that after the active-high reset signal rst is asserted, on the next clock cycle, signals x and y are assigned the correct values from their respective reset state registers.

The property triggers when rst equals 1 at any positive edge of the clock signal clk. When this occurs, the property requires that on the very next clock cycle (##1), signal x must equal the previous value of the lower x_bit bits of rstx, and signal y must equal the previous value of the lower y_bit bits of rsty.

The $past function captures the values of rstx[x_bit-1:0] and rsty[y_bit-1:0] from the clock cycle when rst was asserted. The property is disabled and not checked when rst equals 0.
